description.narrative: Boys and girls, adolescents and women on the move and in host communities equitably access essential health services with sustained coverage of high-impact preventive and curative interventions, which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Boys and girls, adolescents and women on the move and in host communities equitably access essential health services withsustained coverage of high-impact preventive and curative interventions

description.narrative: UNICEF supported 103,370 consultations and primary health care package activities to 9,032 refugee and migrant people living inside shelters, benefiting 4,300 children and adolescents and 2,766 pregnant and lactating women living in official shelters. Also,UNICEF supported local health services through the provision of health professionals to work directly at Primary Health Care facilities in Boa Vista providing 18,910 consultations to refugee and migrants. UNICEF had a crucial role in monitoring COVID-19 cases inside shelters through active community-based surveillance to decrease the spreading among migrants. Also, UNICEF supported COVID-19 vaccination campaigns inside shelters. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2022
